My soul<S>5315</S> is weary<S>5354</S> of my life<S>2416</S>; I will leave<S>5800</S> my complaint<S>7879</S> upon myself; I will speak<S>1696</S> in the bitterness<S>4751</S> of my soul<S>5315</S>. <sup>weary: or, cut off while I live</sup>
I will say<S>559</S> unto God<S>433</S>, Do not condemn<S>7561</S> me; shew<S>3045</S> me wherefore thou contendest<S>7378</S> with me.
Is it good<S>2895</S> unto thee that thou shouldest oppress<S>6231</S>, that thou shouldest despise<S>3988</S> the work<S>3018</S> of thine hands<S>3709</S>, and shine<S>3313</S> upon the counsel<S>6098</S> of the wicked<S>7563</S>? <sup>work: Heb. labour</sup>
Hast thou eyes<S>5869</S> of flesh<S>1320</S>? or seest<S>7200</S> thou as man<S>582</S> seeth<S>7200</S>?
Are thy days<S>3117</S> as the days<S>3117</S> of man<S>582</S>? are thy years<S>8141</S> as man's<S>1397</S> days<S>3117</S>,
That thou enquirest<S>1245</S> after mine iniquity<S>5771</S>, and searchest<S>1875</S> after my sin<S>2403</S>?
Thou knowest<S>1847</S> that I am not wicked<S>7561</S>; and there is none that can deliver<S>5337</S> out of thine hand<S>3027</S>. <sup>Thou: Heb. It is upon thy knowledge</sup>
Thine hands<S>3027</S> have made<S>6087</S> me and fashioned<S>6213</S> me together<S>3162</S> round about<S>5439</S>; yet thou dost destroy<S>1104</S> me. <sup>have: Heb. took pains about me</sup>
Remember<S>2142</S>, I beseech thee, that thou hast made<S>6213</S> me as the clay<S>2563</S>; and wilt thou bring<S>7725</S> me into dust<S>6083</S> again<S>7725</S>?
Hast thou not poured me out<S>5413</S> as milk<S>2461</S>, and curdled<S>7087</S> me like cheese<S>1385</S>?
Thou hast clothed<S>3847</S> me with skin<S>5785</S> and flesh<S>1320</S>, and hast fenced<S>7753</S> me with bones<S>6106</S> and sinews<S>1517</S>. <sup>fenced: Heb. hedged</sup>
Thou hast granted<S>6213</S> me life<S>2416</S> and favour<S>2617</S>, and thy visitation<S>6486</S> hath preserved<S>8104</S> my spirit<S>7307</S>.
And these things hast thou hid<S>6845</S> in thine heart<S>3824</S>: I know<S>3045</S> that this is with thee.
If I sin<S>2398</S>, then thou markest<S>8104</S> me, and thou wilt not acquit<S>5352</S> me from mine iniquity<S>5771</S>.
If I be wicked<S>7561</S>, woe<S>480</S> unto me; and if I be righteous<S>6663</S>, yet will I not lift up<S>5375</S> my head<S>7218</S>. I am full<S>7649</S> of confusion<S>7036</S>; therefore see<S>7202</S> <S>7200</S> thou mine affliction<S>6040</S>;
For it increaseth<S>1342</S>. Thou huntest<S>6679</S> me as a fierce lion<S>7826</S>: and again<S>7725</S> thou shewest thyself marvellous<S>6381</S> upon me.
Thou renewest<S>2318</S> thy witnesses<S>5707</S> against me, and increasest<S>7235</S> thine indignation<S>3708</S> upon me<S>5978</S>; changes<S>2487</S> and war<S>6635</S> are against me. <sup>witnesses: that is, thy plagues</sup>
Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth<S>3318</S> out of the womb<S>7358</S>? Oh that I had given up the ghost<S>1478</S>, and no eye<S>5869</S> had seen<S>7200</S> me!
I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried<S>2986</S> from the womb<S>990</S> to the grave<S>6913</S>.
Are not my days<S>3117</S> few<S>4592</S>? cease<S>2308</S> <S>2308</S> then, and let me alone<S>7896</S> <S>7896</S>, that I may take comfort<S>1082</S> a little<S>4592</S>,
Before I go<S>3212</S> whence I shall not return<S>7725</S>, even to the land<S>776</S> of darkness<S>2822</S> and the shadow of death<S>6757</S>;
A land<S>776</S> of darkness<S>5890</S>, as darkness<S>652</S> itself; and of the shadow of death<S>6757</S>, without any order<S>5468</S>, and where the light<S>3313</S> is as darkness<S>652</S>.
